definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Thaksin and his wife, Pojaman, were in Beijing until Sunday for the opening of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫妇在北京参加奥运开幕式，一直逗留到星期天。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony was moderated by Du Qinglin, Minister of Agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式由农业部部长杜青林主持。

sentences.english: The Opening Ceremony of the Universiade is in Nanshan District.
sentences.chinese: 大运会开幕式在南山区。

sentences.english: What is that like to see Yao carry the flag.
sentences.chinese: 你看到姚明在开幕式举旗进场时感觉怎样？

sentences.english: I do like Mr. Bean on London's opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 我太喜欢伦敦开幕式上的憨豆先生了。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony was a fine spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式典礼是个壮观的场面。

sentences.english: There is nothing to compare. And when we find incomparability, there is already half success," said Chen.
sentences.chinese: 找到了不可比性，就等于亚运会开幕式成功了一半。

sentences.english: UN Under-Secretary-General for Disarmament Affairs Nobuyasu Abe attended and addressed the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 联合国副秘书长阿部信泰出席开幕式并致辞。

sentences.english: Professor Li Yizhong, the son of Sang Hu, also attended the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 桑弧的儿子李毅中也参加了开幕式。

sentences.english: Switching sports, William and Kate are seen in the paddock enclosure on the first day of the Cheltenham Race Festival in 2007.
sentences.chinese: 威廉和凯特在切尔腾汉姆赛马节的开幕式上。

sentences.english: I am very pleased to be here at this opening session of the China Development Forum.
sentences.chinese: 我很高兴能够参加本次中国发展高层论坛开幕式。

sentences.english: After the opening ceremony, Zeng paid a visited the exhibition demonstrating the achievements of One Village One Product movement.
sentences.chinese: 开幕式后，曾庆红参观了“一村一品”成果展。

sentences.english: What's your opinion aboutthe opening ceremony show of the Sports Meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你对今年运动会开幕式表演的评价是什么呢？

sentences.english: The group exercises and artistic performances are also equally important parts of the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 团体操和文艺表演也是开幕式的重要环节。

sentences.english: In the program, everybody also again mentioned that Beijing Olympic Games opening ceremony ignites the ceremonial fire incident.
sentences.chinese: 节目中，大家又再提到北京奥运开幕式燃点圣火一事。

sentences.english: Susilo, President of Indonesia, attended the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 印度尼西亚总统苏希洛出席会议开幕式。

definition: the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
to express in words or writing/to make a speech (esp. short introduction, vote of thanks, afterword, funeral homily etc)/to address (an audience)/same as 致詞|致词
to make a speech/to make some remarks
